issue_title: [Security] load() does not validate file permissions before reading sensitive data
summary: Add permission validation to load() method to detect tampered files with overly permissive permissions.
approach: TDD: Added strict_permissions parameter to load() - rejects world-writable by default, all group/other permissions in strict mode.
risks: Backward compatibility: load() signature changed with new optional parameter
Existing code calling load() without arguments will work (default strict_permissions=False)
World-writable files will now be rejected even in non-strict mode
